header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 278/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000943­2019) Prafullakumar Thokale & Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.25/2019 registered under Sections 498­A, 406, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 498­a, 406, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant Shubhangi Thokale is wife of Applicant No.1. Rest of the Applicants are her in­laws. She married with Applicant No.1 on 28/02/2016. She alleged that, since March 2017, Applicants abused her for demand of gold ring. In August 2017, Applicant No.1 demanded Rs.1 Lakh. In December 2017, she left the house. Again she resumed cohabitation, but there was ill­treatment. Therefore, since January 2018 she started residing separately. Hence, she lodged the report.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Shubhangi Thokale is wife of Applicant No.1.
Rest of the Applicants are her in­laws.
She married with Applicant No.1 on 28/02/2016.
She alleged that, since March 2017, Applicants abused her for demand of gold ring.
In August 2017, Applicant No.1 demanded Rs.1 Lakh.
In December 2017, she left the house.
Again she resumed cohabitation, but there was ill­treatment.
Therefore, since January 2018 she started residing separately.
Hence, she lodged the report.

arguments.text: 3] Applicants submit that, vague allegations are made against them. There is delay in FIR. No recovery is pending against them. They are reputed persons. Therefore, they pray for interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicants submit that, vague allegations are made against them.
There is delay in FIR.
No recovery is pending against them.
They are reputed persons.
Therefore, they pray for interim protection.

arguments.text: 4] Heard Adv. Madhura Deshpande for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard Adv. Madhura Deshpande for Applicants.
Perused the FIR and Papers.

arguments.text: 5] Prima facie, allegations against Applicants are to the extent that, they demanded money and ill­treated Informant. No immediate recovery is shown. Applicants are having roots in the society. Their immediate custody is not necessary. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Prima facie, allegations against Applicants are to the extent that, they demanded money and ill­treated Informant.
No immediate recovery is shown.
Applicants are having roots in the society.
Their immediate custody is not necessary.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No.25/2019 registered under Sections 498­A, 406, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune, Applicants 1] Prafullakumar Thokale, 2] Balu Girijappa Thokale, 3] Sou. Kalpana Balu Thokale, 4] Prajyot Balu Thokale and 5] Sou. Arati Raj Dhere be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) each on the following conditions : [i] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State returnable on 23/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 278/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000943­2019) Prafullakumar Thokale & Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.25/2019 registered under Sections 498­A, 406, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Shubhangi Thokale is wife of Applicant No.1. Rest of the Applicants are her in­laws. She married with Applicant No.1 on 28/02/2016. She alleged that, since March 2017, Applicants abused her for demand of gold ring. In August 2017, Applicant No.1 demanded Rs.1 Lakh. In December 2017, she left the house. Again she resumed cohabitation, but there was ill­treatment. Therefore, since January 2018 she started residing separately. Hence, she lodged the report. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicants submit that, vague allegations are made against them. There is delay in FIR. No recovery is pending against them. They are reputed persons. Therefore, they pray for interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard Adv. Madhura Deshpande for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers.
---argument-ends---
5] Prima facie, allegations against Applicants are to the extent that, they demanded money and ill­treated Informant. No immediate recovery is shown. Applicants are having roots in the society. Their immediate custody is not necessary. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No.25/2019 registered under Sections 498­A, 406, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune, Applicants 1] Prafullakumar Thokale, 2] Balu Girijappa Thokale, 3] Sou. Kalpana Balu Thokale, 4] Prajyot Balu Thokale and 5] Sou. Arati Raj Dhere be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) each on the following conditions : [i] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State returnable on 23/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
sd/­xxx Pune. (Smt. A. V. Rotte) Date : 16/01/2019. Additional Sessions Judge,Pune C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P. D. F. file Order are same word for word as per original Order. Name of the Court :­ Smt. A. V. Rotte, District Judge – 6 and Additional Sessions Judge, Pune Name of the Steno :­ Shri. D. L. Gudde, Stenographer (Grade­II) Date of Order :­ 16/01/2019 Order signed by presiding officer :­ 16/01/2019 Order uploaded on :­ 16/01/2019. ..3..
